intro: Chuquiraga avellanedae, commonly known as the Andean burro's tail, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy yellow to orange flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its unique morphology includes a creeping growth habit with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture. Chuquiraga avellannedae is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in local communities.
